workflow.name: Summarize Google Play Store reviews with GPT-4-mini, Pinecone & Slack alerts
workflow.description:
This workflow automatically fetches reviews for one or more Google Play Store apps, summarizes the feedback using OpenAI, stores and manages review data with Pinecone, and posts the summary to a Slack channel. It is designed for product teams, community managers, or anyone who wants to keep track of app sentiment and review trends without manually reading each review.

**Features:**

- Fetches daily reviews for specified Google Play Store app bundle IDs using a Google Service Account.
- Stores reviews in a Pinecone vector database for efficient retrieval and summarization.
- Uses OpenAI to generate a summary, including:
  - Positive and negative review highlights
  - Star rating breakdown and average rating
  - Total number of reviews processed
- Posts the summary to a Slack channel of your choice.
- Supports both daily and weekly triggers.
- Automatically clears old reviews from the vector store weekly to keep data fresh.

**Setup Instructions:**

- Add your Google Play app bundle IDs in the ‚ÄúSet the bundle ids‚Äù node.
- Configure your Google Service Account, Pinecone, OpenAI, and Slack credentials.
- Set your preferred Slack channel in the ‚ÄúSend to Slack channel‚Äù node.
- Enable the workflow and customize the schedule as needed.

**Use Cases:**

- Monitor app sentiment and user feedback trends.
- Share review insights with your team in Slack.
- Automate reporting for product or support teams.

workflow.name: Create summary of Google Play Store reviews

parameters.text: =Create a summary of store reviews submitted. Start your message with "Hi! This is your Google Play Store AI agent for *{{$json.app_name}}*". In your output, include the number of reviews you processed to create the summary. The summary should be split into two groups: a summary about positive reviews and a summary about negative reviews. In your summary include also a breakdown of star ratings, ie. how many reviews there were for each star rating. Also include the average star rating.

options.systemMessage: =Your job is to respond to prompts using the information you gather from the Google Play Store reviews of an app called {{$json.app_name}}. Your main role is to help your users to gain insights from store review without having to read reviews one by one. Store review usually have star ratings with 1 star being the lowest rating and 5 star being the highest rating. They can also have a text description where the user writes a review about their experience with the app. These can be negative reviews or positive reviews. The lower the star rating the more likely that the review is negative.

parameters.content: Define the list of bundle ids of the Google Play Store apps you want to summarise reviews for. Bundle ids can be found in the Google Play Store url of the app. For example, bundle id of the app with url https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.tripledot.blockbash is com.tripledot.blockbash
Loop over bundle ids (apps) in the list
Fetch reviews from Google with a service account
Store the previous day's reviews in the vector store. Create a different namespace for each app (bundle id). Clear the name space once a week to remove old reviews.

parameters.jsonData: =comment: {{ $json.reviews.comments[0].userComment.text }} | date: {{ $json.reviews.comments[0].userComment.lastModified.seconds.toDateTime('s') }} | star rating: {{ $json.reviews.comments[0].userComment.starRating }} | app version: {{ $json.reviews.comments[0].userComment.appVersionName }} | language: {{ $json.reviews.comments[0].userComment.reviewerLanguage }}

parameters.content: Loop over bundle ids (apps) in the list
Define app bundle ids and names

parameters.toolDescription: This is the vector store for the Google Play reviews data you need to answer queries

parameters.content: Generate Google Play Store review summary for the app
Post the summary to a Slack channel
Prepare and send the summary once a week

## Google Play Store Reviews Summary with Pinecone, OpenAI & Slack Notification

This workflow automatically fetches reviews for one or more Google Play Store apps, summarizes the feedback using OpenAI, stores and manages review data with Pinecone, and posts the summary to a Slack channel. It is designed for product teams, community managers, or anyone who wants to keep track of app sentiment and review trends without manually reading each review.

**Features:**

* Fetches daily reviews for specified Google Play Store app bundle IDs using a Google Service Account.
* Stores reviews in a Pinecone vector database for efficient retrieval and summarization.
* Uses OpenAI to generate a summary, including:
  * Positive and negative review highlights
  * Star rating breakdown and average rating
  * Total number of reviews processed
* Posts the summary to a Slack channel of your choice.
* Supports both daily and weekly triggers.
* Automatically clears old reviews from the vector store weekly to keep data fresh.


**Setup Instructions:**

1. Add your Google Play app bundle IDs in the ‚ÄúSet the bundle ids‚Äù node.
2. Configure your Google Service Account, Pinecone, OpenAI, and Slack credentials.
3. Set your preferred Slack channel in the ‚ÄúSend to Slack channel‚Äù node.
4. Enable the workflow and customize the schedule as needed.


**Use Cases:**

* Monitor app sentiment and user feedback trends.
* Share review insights with your team in Slack.
* Automate reporting for product or support teams.

data.details: The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
